definitions.definition: Transverse ; lying across the main direction.
examples: At the end of each row were cross benches which linked the rows.
His actions were perversely cross to his own happiness.

definitions.definition: Opposing , adverse ; being contrary to what one would hope or wish for.
Made in an opposite direction, or an inverse relation; mutually inverse; interchanged.
Of the sea, having two wave systems traveling at oblique angles, due to the wind over shifting direction or the waves of two storm systems meeting.

main_definition: Transverse ; lying across the main direction.
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) Opposing , adverse ; being contrary to what one would hope or wish for.
( chiefly British , Ottawa Valley ) Bad-tempered , angry , annoyed .
Made in an opposite direction, or an inverse relation; mutually inverse; interchanged.
( nautical ) Of the sea, having two wave systems traveling at oblique angles, due to the wind over shifting direction or the waves of two storm systems meeting.
